alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 6:15PM CDT until June 02 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Washita and Custer Counties.
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC039-149-021115- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.Y.0018.220601T2315Z-220602T1800Z/ /CLIO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 615 PM CDT Wed Jun 1 2022 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...From this evening to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Near bankfull conditions occur along the Washita River... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Flooding is limited to only bottom lands where smaller streams enter the Washita River valley. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.5 feet just after midnight tonight. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
